message.content:
cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CV, cs.CL 

The paper deals with automated news visual storyline editing with social media content, which involves tasks such as finding the right content and ensuring that news content evolves coherently over time. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV), or Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-categories. However, since the paper focuses on visual storytelling with social media data, it is most likely to belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The other sub-categories are also relevant because they involve tasks such as information retrieval, social network analysis, computer vision, and natural language processing, which are all relevant to the paper's proposed benchmark for assessing social media visual storylines.
